page_privacy.title: Privacy Statement
page_privacy.privacy1_description1: It starts with a short introduction, why you write this privacy statement and that you explain how you handle this data.
page_privacy.privacy2_description1: State your company name, contact details, etc. Do you have a larger company and a Data Protection Officer? Then you are obliged to state the contact details of the official.
page_privacy.privacy3_description1: That therefore differs per company, it also depends on whether you are active on social media. Logically, most companies collect a (company) name, telephone number, e-mail address, social media account names, etc.
page_privacy.privacy4: The purpose of collecting the data
page_privacy.privacy4_description1: Explain the purpose of collecting the personal data. For example, because you want to send the customer or user newsletters, you want to use the data to make an offer or because you want to respond to an online response. When a customer e-mails you with a question about a product, you cannot simply send a newsletter to that person.
page_privacy.privacy5: The retention period of the data
page_privacy.privacy5_description1: There is no specific retention period for personal data in the AVG. Companies determine for themselves how long they keep this information, but you must indicate this. This will differ greatly per company.
page_privacy.privacy5_description2: Use concrete examples to make the explanation in the privacy statement as clear as possible.
page_privacy.privacy5_description3: Some companies keep data for five years in order to respond appropriately and adequately based on earlier contact.
page_privacy.privacy5_description4: If you have a forum on your website, you can, for example, state that the comments under messages always remain, because other users respond to them and you otherwise influence a discussion.
page_privacy.privacy6: Other recipients of the personal data
page_privacy.privacy6_description1: There are more parties that receive the personal data. You must state this in the privacy statement. For example, there is the hosting party, your accountant who processes invoices, delivery services (the mail!), The mail server, etc.
page_privacy.privacy7: The rights of the visitor / customer
page_privacy.privacy7_description1: Let the reader or visitor know what rights he has. For example, he has the right to change or even delete his data. Your customers and employees can ask you as an entrepreneur to view their own data or to forward it to another organization. They can also withdraw their consent to use the data.
page_privacy.privacy7_description2: With the AVG they have the 'Right to be forgotten'.
page_privacy.privacy8_description1: Name the programs that collect cookies. For example, if you offer social media channels to share content, let them know that these companies (Facebook, Twitter) are responsible for this part. The same goes for embedding YouTube videos.
page_privacy.privacy8_description2: If you link to external websites, these websites are responsible for their own policies. Therefore, refer them to their privacy statement.
page_privacy.privacy8_description3: If you use Google Analytics, let the visitors know that you are doing this and why. Also explain what Google does with these cookies (save to server, use to create reports). Also refer here to Google's privacy policy.
